description: This file appears to be a source code implementation for a Wi-Fi Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL). It contains functions for invoking Wi-Fi API methods, handling different data types (bool, unsigned long, string, int, unsigned int), and managing Wi-Fi configurations and settings. It also includes initialization and prerequisite check functions, as well as some wrapper methods for external API calls.

classes.name: WIFIHAL
classes.description: Wrapper class providing high-level methods for Wi-Fi HAL operations, including initialization, prerequisite checks, and parameter management via JSON requests.

methods.name: initialize
methods.description: Initializes the WIFIHAL class and prepares it for operation.

methods.name: testmodulepre_requisites
methods.description: Sets up necessary pre-requirements for the Wi-Fi HAL module, such as calling wifi_init if needed.

methods.name: testmodulepost_requisites
methods.description: Resets or cleans up the setup after tests.

methods.name: void WIFIHAL_GetOrSetParamBoolValue(IN const Json::Value & req,OUT Json::Value & response)
methods.description: Controls get/set operations on boolean Wi-Fi parameters based on JSON request input.

methods.name: void WIFIHAL_GetOrSetParamULongValue(IN const Json::Value & req,OUT Json::Value & response)
methods.description: Controls get/set operations on unsigned long Wi-Fi parameters based on JSON request input.

methods.name: void WIFIHAL_GetOrSetParamStringValue(IN const Json::Value & req,OUT Json::Value & response)
methods.description: Controls get/set operations on string Wi-Fi parameters based on JSON request input.

methods.name: void WIFIHAL_GetOrSetRadioStandard(IN const Json::Value & req,OUT Json::Value & response)
methods.description: Manages Wi-Fi radio standard settings (e.g., 802.11g/n/ac) via get/set, including support for multiple standards.

methods.name: void WIFIHAL_GetWifiTrafficStats(IN const Json::Value & req,OUT Json::Value & response)
methods.description: Retrieves Wi-Fi traffic statistics for a specified access point index and formats the result into a JSON response.

methods.name: WIFIHAL_SteeringClientDisconnect
methods.description: Disconnects a specified client MAC address from a Wi-Fi steering group, invoking lower-level API and returning success or failure.

methods.name: WIFIHAL_SteeringClientSet
methods.description: Configures steering parameters for a client, such as RSSI thresholds and rejection reasons, via corresponding API calls.

methods.name: WIFIHAL_SteeringClientRemove
methods.description: Removes a client MAC from a steering group, invoking the related API.

methods.name: void WIFIHAL_GetBTMClientCapabilityList(IN const Json::Value & req,OUT Json::Value & response)
methods.description: Retrieves BTM (BSS Transition Management) capabilities list for a client MAC address.

methods.name: void WIFIHAL_GetApRoamingConsortiumElement(IN const Json::Value & req,OUT Json::Value & response)
methods.description: Fetches the roaming consortium element details for an access point.

methods.name: WIFIHAL_PushApRoamingConsortiumElement
methods.description: Pushes a list of OUI values and their lengths as the roaming consortium element for an access point.

methods.name: void WIFIHAL_GetApInterworkingElement(IN const Json::Value & req,OUT Json::Value & response)
methods.description: Retrieves the Interworking element configuration for a given radio index.

methods.name: WIFIHAL_PushApInterworkingElement
methods.description: Sets the Interworking element configuration for a radio, including activation, network type, and HESSID.

methods.name: void WIFIHAL_EnableCSIEngine(IN const Json::Value & req,OUT Json::Value & response)
methods.description: Enables or disables CSI (Channel State Information) data collection for a specific client MAC and AP index.

methods.name: WIFIHAL_SendDataFrame
methods.description: Sends a data frame over Wi-Fi with specified parameters including MAC address, length, protocol, and priority.

methods.name: void WIFIHAL_GetVAPTelemetry(IN const Json::Value & req,OUT Json::Value & response)
methods.description: Retrieves telemetry data for a specified VAP, such as TX overflow counts.

methods.name: void WIFIHAL_GetRadioVapInfoMap(IN const Json::Value & req,OUT Json::Value & response)
methods.description: Gets the mapping of VAPs associated with a radio index.

methods.name: WIFIHAL_SetNeighborReports
methods.description: Configures neighbor report information for a given access point.

methods.name: void WIFIHAL_GetApAssociatedClientDiagnosticResult(IN const Json::Value & req,OUT Json::Value & response)
methods.description: Fetches detailed diagnostic results for an associated client MAC, including signal strength, data rates, and retransmissions.

methods.name: void WIFIHAL_GetAPCapabilities(IN const Json::Value & req,OUT Json::Value & response)
methods.description: Fetches operational capabilities of an access point, including supported security modes and features.

methods.name: void WIFIHAL_GetAvailableBSSColor(IN const Json::Value & req,OUT Json::Value & response)
methods.description: Retrieves available BSS colors for a given radio index, helping in network management in overlapping Wi-Fi channels.

methods.name: void WIFIHAL_GetOrSetFTMobilityDomainID(IN const Json::Value & req,OUT Json::Value & response)
methods.description: Gets or sets the FT Mobility Domain ID for a specified AP and radio index.

methods.name: void WIFIHAL_GetOrSetFTR0KeyHolderID(IN const Json::Value & req,OUT Json::Value & response)
methods.description: Gets or sets the FTR0 Key Holder ID for a specific AP and radio index.

methods.name: void WIFIHAL_GetRMCapabilities(IN const Json::Value & req,OUT Json::Value & response)
methods.description: Retrieves Radio Resource Management capabilities related to a peer MAC address.

methods.name: void WIFIHAL_GetApSecurity(IN const Json::Value & req,OUT Json::Value & response)
methods.description: Obtains current security configuration for an access point, including modes, encryption, and keys.

methods.name: WIFIHAL_SetApSecurity
methods.description: Configures security settings on an access point, including security mode, encryption, and keys.
